com.ikalagaming.packages

Class PackageManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ikalagaming.packages.PackageManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Package

    public class PackageManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements Package
    Handles loading, unloading and storage of Packages. This is considered a package, but is always enabled and never loaded.
    Author:
    Ches Burks

      Constructs a new PackageManager and initializes variables.

    • Method Detail

      • disable

        public boolean disable()
        Description copied from interface: Package
        Deactivates the package and halts all of its operations. The package is still loaded in memory but not active. Calls Package.onDisable(). This should change the packages state to DISABLING. If the disabling were done here and not in the Package.onDisable() method, the package state should be changed to DISABLED after completion. Otherwise the change to DISABLED is handled in the onDisable method.
        Specified by:
        disable in interface Package
        Returns:
        true if the package has been successfully disabled

      • enable

        public boolean enable()
        Description copied from interface: Package
        Activates the package and enables it to perform its normal functions. Calls Package.onEnable(). This should change the package state to ENABLING. If the enabling were done here and not in the Package.onEnable() method, the package state should be changed to ENABLED after completion. Otherwise the change to ENABLED is handled in the onEnable method.
        Specified by:
        enable in interface Package
        Returns:
        true if the package was successfully enabled

      • fireEvent

        public boolean fireEvent(Event event)
        Fires an event with a message to a package type from the package manager. If an error occurs, this will return false. The event should not have been sent if false was returned.
        Parameters:
        event - the event to fire
        Returns:
        true if the event was fired correctly

      • getName

        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • getPackage

        public Package getPackage(java.lang.String type)
        If a package of type exists (isLoaded(String)), then the package that is of that type is returned. If no package exists of that type, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        type - The package type
        Returns:
        the Package with the given type or null if none exists

      • getPackageState

        public PackageState getPackageState()
        Description copied from interface: Package
        Returns the current state of the package. This should be updated as the package is interacted with, and is recommended to default to DISABLED if the state is not set yet. This is to prevent the package from being accessed inappropriately.
        Specified by:
        getPackageState in interface Package
        Returns:
        a PackageState representing the status of this package

      • getResourceBundle

        public java.util.ResourceBundle getResourceBundle()
        Returns the resource bundle for the package manager. This is not safe and could be null.
        Returns:
        the current resource bundle

      • getVersion

        public double getVersion()
        Description copied from interface: Package
        Returns this classes version number. This changes periodically for each package subclass as they are changed and updated.
        Specified by:
        getVersion in interface Package
        Returns:
        the version

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Description copied from interface: Package
        Returns true if the package is enabled, and false otherwise. A state of ENABLED returns true, any other states will return false.
        Specified by:
        isEnabled in interface Package
        Returns:
        true if the package is fully ready to operate

      • isLoaded

        public boolean isLoaded(Package type)
        Returns true if a package exists that has the same type as the provided package (for example: "Graphics"). This is the same as calling isLoaded(Package.getType())
        Parameters:
        type - the package type
        Returns:
        true if the package is loaded in memory, false if it does not exist

      • isLoaded

        public boolean isLoaded(java.lang.String type)
        Returns true if a package exists with the given type (for example: "Graphics")'
        Parameters:
        type - the package type
        Returns:
        true if the package is loaded in memory, false if it does not exist

      • loadPackage

        public boolean loadPackage(Package toLoad)

        Loads the given package into memory, stores it by type, and enables it if packages are enabled on load by default.

        If the type of package already exists in the manager, and the new package has a higher version number, then the old package is unloaded and the new one is loaded in its place. If the versions are equal, or the new package is older, then it does not load the new version and returns false.

        Parameters:
        toLoad - the package to load
        Returns:
        true if the package was loaded properly, false otherwise

      • loadPlugin

        public boolean loadPlugin(java.lang.String name)
        Loads a plugin from a name
        Parameters:
        name - the filename to load from
        Returns:
        true on success, false if it failed

      • onDisable

        public void onDisable()
        Description copied from interface: Package
        This method is called when the package is disabled, and gives the package the chance to shut itself down and save any changes made in memory to disk if necessary. After the package is done disabling, the package state should be changed to DISABLED.
        Specified by:
        onDisable in interface Package

      • onEnable

        public void onEnable()
        Description copied from interface: Package
        This method is called when the package is enabled. Initialization should be performed here, and configuration and data should be loaded from disk if necessary. After the package is done setting up and is ready to be used, the package state should be changed to ENABLED.
        Specified by:
        onEnable in interface Package

      • onLoad

        public void onLoad()
        Description copied from interface: Package
        Called when the package is loaded into memory. The package may or may not be enabled at this time. The Package State should be set to PackageState.LOADING just before loading has started. After it is fully loaded, it should be enabled based on the value of PackageSettings.ENABLE_ON_LOAD. If it is not enabled then the package state should be set to PackageState.DISABLED.
        Specified by:
        onLoad in interface Package

      • onUnload

        public void onUnload()
        Description copied from interface: Package
        Called when the package is unloaded from memory. If it is enabled, then the package should disable itself now. The Package State should be set to UNLOADING just before unloading has started. Any memory that can reasonably be dereferenced by the package itself, should be. Files may be saved to disk if needed. After completion of the unloading, the Package State should be set to PENDING_REMOVAL.
        Specified by:
        onUnload in interface Package

      • reload

        public boolean reload()
        Description copied from interface: Package
        This is essentially restarting the package. The general flow is as follows:
        1. If the package is enabled , disable it by calling Package.disable().
        2. Set the Package State to UNLOADING and perform the operations Package.onUnload() carries out. A Package state of PENDING_REMOVAL is not used as the framework should stay loaded. This should return the package to a fresh state, as it would appear during the first time loading just before Package.onLoad() is called
        3. Loading the package by calling Package.onLoad() or performing the operations it carries out which are applicable at this time
        4. The package is enabled using Package.enable()
        Specified by:
        reload in interface Package
        Returns:
        true if the package reloaded successfully

      • setPackageState

        public void setPackageState(PackageState newState)
        Description copied from interface: Package
        Sets the current state of the package. This should be used to update the package state as it is interacted with, This exists to assist with thread safety.
        Specified by:
        setPackageState in interface Package
        Parameters:
        newState - The state the package should now be

      • unloadPackage

        public void unloadPackage(Package toUnload)
        Attempts to unload the package from memory. Does nothing if the package is not loaded. Packages are disabled before unloading. This calls unloadPackage(String) using the package type.
        Parameters:
        toUnload - The type of package to unload

      • unloadPackage

        public boolean unloadPackage(java.lang.String toUnload)
        Attempts to unload the package from memory. If no package exists with the given name (isLoaded(String)), returns false and does nothing.
        Parameters:
        toUnload - The type of package to unload
        Returns:
        true if the package was unloaded properly
